meta.title: Hamin Lee - Resume
meta.description: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products.
meta.portfolioDescription: Software 3.0 - The Era of LLM-Programmable Systems

hero.title: Full-Stack Engineer Hamin Lee
hero.description: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products.
hero.summary: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products. I specialize in bridging mobile on-device AI with real-time media/robotics through streaming and low-latency control, achieving both user experience and performance with privacy-centric architecture and PWA/edge deployment. I have experience launching and operating multiple projects with end-to-end ownership from product initialization to deployment/operation automation.

sections.projectsDescription: I've explored new technologies and realized ideas through various side projects.
sections.publicationsDescription: Books containing insights on technology and development.
sections.hackathonsDescription: Awards from various competitions and certifications I hold.

data.description: Aspiring full-stack engineer who finds great joy in confirming performance improvements through actual testing and measurement.
data.summary: Aspiring full-stack engineer who finds great joy in confirming performance improvements through actual testing and measurement. I enjoy directly applying new technologies and diverse knowledge, and love the exploratory process of gradually clarifying concepts that were previously unclear.

eeboon.title: Full-Stack Developer
eeboon.description: Responsible for full-stack development and maintenance of company products. Developed and maintained client web applications, admin dashboard, and API service admin dashboard. Maintained Figma Plugin. Implemented and maintained CI/CD for entire product suite. Refactored operating environment to improve visibility and maintainability by organizing unnecessary code, repositories, and AWS cloud resources. Reduced API response time (from minutes â†’ within 8 seconds). Optimized AI model serving server (24 seconds â†’ 4 seconds). Analyzed pptx-automizer library and added multi-element modification logic. Refactored AI model serving server based on layered architecture. Optimized Docker Compose + ECR environment.

tax.title: Backend Developer
tax.description: Tax accounting SaaS backend development. Responsible for Nest.js backend development. Implemented and modularized business logic reflecting various calculation rules (deduction items, ratio calculations, amount range conditions, etc.).

megapress.title: Backend Developer
megapress.description: Migrated from Express to NestJS to improve standardized development environment and maintainability. Applied hexagonal architecture. Integrated Next.js/NestJS services into Turborepo + pnpm-based monorepo to establish common module reuse system and eliminate duplicate code. Checked service stability through load testing with ngrinder. Managed AWS infrastructure (EC2 monitoring, new site domain setup).

buymeslim.title: Full-Stack Developer (Freelance)
buymeslim.description: Developed and maintained clothing fitting reservation app. Developed backend server with Python/Django, handled REST API with DRF, implemented login and reservation-related CRUD. Improved customer convenience with SmartStore crawling. Developed cross-platform app with Flutter, managed state with Provider package, applied MVVM design pattern. Developed admin page with Next.js.

problem.title: LLAMI App Development Background
problem.subtitle: Business Problem Definition
problem.problem1: â€¢ 95% bounce rate on payment page
problem.problem2: â€¢ Customer interview: "Hesitant to pay due to many free AI services"
problem.problem3: â€¢ CAC 5x higher than investor requirements
problem.problem4: â€¢ Existing AI service cost reduction methods only suitable for large-scale services
problem.quote: "A new approach to dramatically reduce AI service fixed costs is required"

design.title: LLAMI App Design
design.subtitle: Requirements and Solutions
design.solution1: â†’ Complete server cost elimination through on-device AI app design
design.requirement2: Requirement 2: App Development with Web Team
design.solution2: â†’ Expo WebView + React Native/C++ hybrid design for core modules only
design.solution3: â†’ Fine-tune Gemma3 SLM and deploy as GGUF model

implementation.title: LLAMI App Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.item1Detail1: â€¢ Observable State-based Expo â†” React Native state sharing
implementation.item2Detail1: â€¢ Cloudflare R2-based GGUF model deployment
implementation.item2Detail2: â€¢ Model updates without app reinstallation
implementation.item3Detail1: â€¢ iOS Metal GPU acceleration via llama.cpp
implementation.item4Detail1: â€¢ Web developers can develop without native knowledge
implementation.decision1: â€¢ Fast MVP with React components â†’ Gradual React Native transition
implementation.decision2: â€¢ 60% code reduction through bridge pattern abstraction
implementation.decision3: â€¢ 50% build time reduction with EAS Build automation
implementation.decision4: â€¢ Type safety through Observable-based state management

results.title: LLAMI App Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact
results.business1: â€¢ Transformed technical constraints into business opportunities
results.business2: â€¢ Achieved zero fixed costs with on-device AI
results.business3: â€¢ Optimized deployment costs with Cloudflare R2
results.technical1: â€¢ Finding balance between fast development vs good design
results.technical2: â€¢ Importance of gradual migration strategy
results.technical3: â€¢ Choosing tech stack matching team capabilities

problem.title: LLAMI Robotics - Quadruped Robot
problem.subtitle: DeepRobotics Robot Dog Remote Control and Autonomous Navigation Platform
problem.contributionValue: Hamin Lee 50%: Development of DeepRobotics Lite3 robot dog remote control and autonomous navigation system. Robot control via WebRTC-based real-time video streaming and WebSocket communication, SLAM-based mapping and path planning algorithm implementation
problem.challenge1Title: Lack of Robot Web Communication Protocol
problem.challenge1Desc: DeepRobotics Lite3 uses UDP binary protocol, no official web SDK available
problem.challenge2Desc: RTSP stream cannot be played directly in web, HLS has 3~5 second delay
problem.challenge3Desc: Handling multi-layer constraints including obstacle avoidance, work area constraints, and preferred paths
problem.challenge4Desc: Unstable white balance from robot camera, CPU-based video processing causes frame drops at 30fps

design.title: LLAMI Robotics Design
design.subtitle: Key Design Decisions
design.detail1: Real-time transmission of robot control commands and status data
design.detail2: RTSP â†’ H.264 RTP Transcoding â†’ WebRTC Transmission
design.detail3: Real-time environment map generation based on LiDAR data
design.detail4: Optimal path search based on multi-layer cost map

implementation.title: LLAMI Robotics Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.challenge1Situation: Situation: Need to implement binary protocol directly without official SDK
implementation.challenge1Action: Action: Packet analysis with Wireshark, parsing 200+ bytes of robot status data
implementation.challenge1Impact: Impact: Achieved real-time bidirectional communication (500ms cycle)
implementation.challenge2Situation: Situation: RTSP cannot be played on web, HLS has 3~5 second delay
implementation.challenge2Action: Action: RTSP â†’ H.264 RTP transcoding with FFmpeg, WebRTC transmission with mediasoup
implementation.challenge2Impact: Impact: Latency reduced from 3~5 seconds â†’ 300~500ms (90% reduction)
implementation.challenge3Situation: Situation: Autonomous navigation needed in complex environments
implementation.challenge3Action: Action: Multi-layer cost map generation, A* algorithm with 8-directional neighbor search
implementation.challenge3Impact: Impact: Average 45ms path planning in 4000Ã—4000 virtual world
implementation.challenge4Situation: Situation: CPU-based video processing causes frame drops
implementation.challenge4Action: Action: GPU acceleration with WebGL Fragment Shader
implementation.challenge4Impact: Impact: Real-time 30fps processing at 1920Ã—1080 resolution, CPU usage below 5%

results.title: LLAMI Robotics Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact and Learnings
results.technical1: â€¢ Turborepo monorepo separating apps (web, motion-host, proxy)
results.technical2: â€¢ Reactive state management with LegendState Observable pattern
results.technical3: â€¢ Minimize CPU load with WebGL GPU acceleration
results.technical4: â€¢ Multi-client scalability with mediasoup SFU
results.learning1: â€¢ Low-level UDP protocol implementation and binary data parsing experience
results.learning2: â€¢ WebRTC SFU architecture design and real-time streaming optimization
results.learning3: â€¢ Application of path planning algorithms to actual robot control

problem.title: aka-browser: Mini Browser Development
problem.subtitle: Project Overview and Background
problem.painPoint1: â€¢ Need for secondary browser without replacing main browser
problem.quote: "When viewing reference materials or watching videos while working, I needed a lightweight browser that could always stay on top without switching tabs in the main browser."

design.title: aka-browser Design
design.subtitle: System Architecture
design.decision2Detail1: â€¢ IPC channels: Main â†” Renderer process separation
design.decision2Detail2: â€¢ Type safety: TypeScript interface definitions
design.decision2Detail3: â€¢ Security validation: Sender verification in all IPC requests
design.decision3Detail1: â€¢ Inactive tabs: Stop rendering with removeChildView()
design.decision3Detail2: â€¢ LRU cache: Store theme colors for 100 domains

implementation.title: aka-browser Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Core Implementation Details
implementation.feature1Detail2: â€¢ EVS VMP signing automation (afterPack hook)
implementation.feature2Detail2: â€¢ Preview capture â†’ Tab switch â†’ Theme apply
implementation.feature2Detail3: â€¢ Tab switching <100ms, LRU cache optimization
implementation.feature3Detail1: â€¢ Protocol/domain validation + IPC sender verification
implementation.feature4Detail1: â€¢ Bookmarks: JSON CRUD + IPC synchronization
implementation.feature4Detail2: â€¢ Error pages: 100+ error code mapping
implementation.challenge1Problem: Manual VMP signing required for every build
implementation.challenge1Solution: EVS signing automation with electron-builder afterPack hook
implementation.challenge2Problem: UI delay from theme color recalculation during tab switch
implementation.challenge2Solution: LRU cache stores theme colors for 100 domains
implementation.challenge3Problem: Sandbox must be disabled for DRM playback

results.title: aka-browser Results
results.subtitle: Project Achievements
results.learning1Detail: Netflix UA policy change â†’ Domain-specific UA switch (2 hours)
results.learning2Detail: Widevine verification failure â†’ EVS signing automation
results.learning3Detail: Static HTML â†’ React TSX dynamic generation
results.learning4Detail: Sandbox disabled â†’ 4-layer validation maintains security

problem.title: Curiosity Development Background
problem.subtitle: On-Premise AI Coding Platform for Rapid MVP Validation by Non-Developers
problem.problem1: â€¢ Outsourced development cost: Minimum $50K+, 2-3 months required
problem.problem2: â€¢ No-code tool limitations: No customization possible
problem.problem3: â€¢ Developer hiring: Labor cost burden in early-stage startups
problem.existingTool1: â€¢ Cursor/Windsurf: Local environment setup required, high barrier for non-developers
problem.existingTool2: â€¢ Bolt.new: Cloud-dependent, data security concerns
problem.existingTool3: â€¢ v0.dev: UI generation only, no backend logic
problem.existingTool4: â€¢ Replit Agent: Cloud-dependent, no on-premise option
problem.quote: "We needed an AI coding platform that runs instantly in the browser without installation, allowing non-developers to validate ideas immediately."

design.title: Curiosity Design
design.subtitle: Requirements and Solutions
design.requirement1Detail1: â†’ Build in-browser Node.js environment with WebContainer API
design.requirement1Detail2: â€¢ Provide instant dev environment with browser only, no local installation
design.requirement1Detail3: â€¢ Manage WebContainer instance with global singleton pattern
design.requirement2Detail2: â€¢ Easy on-premise deployment with Hono-based lightweight API server
design.requirement2Detail3: â€¢ Environment variable-based AI provider configuration
design.requirement3Title: 3. Fast Feedback with Real-Time AI Response
design.requirement3Detail1: â†’ Design SSE-based streaming response system
design.requirement3Detail2: â€¢ Real-time token-level streaming with AsyncGenerator pattern
design.requirement3Detail3: â€¢ Instant feedback by separating partial and complete responses
design.requirement4Detail1: â†’ Design recursive tool execution engine
design.requirement4Detail2: â€¢ Infinite loop structure: API call â†’ Tool execution â†’ API call
design.requirement4Detail3: â€¢ Prevent infinite loops with repetition pattern detection algorithm

implementation.title: Curiosity Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.feature1Detail1: â€¢ Global instance management: Reuse same WebContainer across components
implementation.feature1Detail2: â€¢ Multi-path retry logic: Auto-try 4 formats like /path, path, ./path
implementation.feature1Detail3: â€¢ Custom command support: Place scripts in .curiosity folder
implementation.feature2Detail1: â€¢ AsyncGenerator-based streaming: OpenAI/Anthropic API chunk-level responses
implementation.feature2Detail2: â€¢ Partial message accumulation: Token accumulation with accumulatedText and real-time UI updates
implementation.feature2Detail3: â€¢ Cost and time tracking: Calculate cost based on token usage in final response
implementation.feature3Detail1: â€¢ Unlimited depth recursion: Auto-execute tool chain with processMessageRecursively(depth) function
implementation.feature3Detail2: â€¢ Repetition pattern detection: Track recent 5 history, stop after 3 identical pattern repeats
implementation.feature3Detail3: â€¢ Individual tool timeout: Apply 30-second timeout to each tool execution
implementation.decision1: â€¢ Fast MVP vs Perfect Design: Reduce complexity with recursive pattern
implementation.decision2: â€¢ Performance vs Stability: Prioritize stability with timeout and repetition detection
implementation.decision3: â€¢ Cloud vs On-Premise: Prioritize on-premise design for data security

results.title: Curiosity Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact and Achievements
results.architecture1: â€¢ Maximized resource efficiency with WebContainer singleton pattern
results.architecture2: â€¢ Simplified complex business logic with recursive structure
results.architecture3: â€¢ Scalable structure with client-server tool separation
results.balance1: â€¢ Solved infinite recursion risk with pattern detection
results.balance2: â€¢ Designed so individual tool failures don't halt entire flow
results.balance3: â€¢ Provided intuitive feedback understandable by non-developers
results.discontinued2: â€¢ External API dependency removal goal unmet
results.discontinued3: â€¢ Resource focus shifted to LLAMI App project
results.future2: â€¢ Complete standalone execution in closed networks

hero.title: Side Projects
hero.subtitle: Open Source Library Collection
hero.description: I've created and published general-purpose open-source libraries for functionality I needed during development. Each project is designed to solve real problems and is written in TypeScript to ensure type safety.

mugunghwa.title: Mugunghwa
mugunghwa.description: An open-source module that implements a base-72 encoding system using pure Korean characters, inspired by Base 32 which combines English letters and numbers.

biggest.title: Biggest
biggest.description: A lightweight 2kb library for safely calculating arbitrary-precision large integers and decimals.

pseudoShuffle.title: Pseudo Shuffle
pseudoShuffle.description: A deterministic pseudo-random shuffle library that creates shuffled-looking indices without actually shuffling.

edgeCrypto.title: Edge Crypto
edgeCrypto.description: A unified SubtleCrypto utility that works across Node.js, browsers, and Cloudflare Workers without external dependencies.

gaussSpiral.title: Gauss Spiral
gaussSpiral.description: Efficiently computes (x, y) â†” n mapping for spiral enumeration filling circles with points from center outward.

curseScript.title: Curse Script
curseScript.description: A JavaScript obfuscator that transforms code into spell-like obfuscated syntax.

akaBrowser.title: Aka Browser
akaBrowser.description: Created an open-source browser based on the Chromium engine. It's a secondary browser concept that stays always on top without replacing the main browser, and completed beta release with Electron. Implemented encrypted content streaming playback for Netflix/Disney+/Prime Video based on Widevine DRM.

mugunghwa.pageDescription: A TypeScript library for encoding/decoding decimal numbers to Korean characters
mugunghwa.title: ðŸŒº Mugunghwa
mugunghwa.subtitle: Korean Base-72 Encoding Library
mugunghwa.introduction: Mugunghwa is a TypeScript library that encodes/decodes decimal numbers to Korean characters. It leverages Korean language characteristics to convert numbers into concise and readable Korean strings.
mugunghwa.feature1: Base-72 System: Efficient number encoding using Korean combinations
mugunghwa.feature2: Profanity Filtering: Automatically excludes inappropriate word combinations
mugunghwa.feature3: Bidirectional Conversion: Supports number â†” Korean string conversion
mugunghwa.feature4: Typo Correction: Automatically corrects typos in similar characters
mugunghwa.feature5: TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions provided
mugunghwa.whatIsMugunghwaDesc1: Mugunghwa Code is a coding system that represents numbers in Korean.
mugunghwa.whatIsMugunghwaDesc2: It allows you to represent more numbers with shorter lengths than digits alone.
mugunghwa.principleDesc2: 84 Korean characters form base-72 in Mugunghwa Code.
mugunghwa.encodingMethodDesc1: When converting base-10 to base-72, group 2 characters into base-5184,
mugunghwa.encodingMethodDesc2: and if one character remains at the end, represent it in base-72.
mugunghwa.profanityFilteringDesc1: Mugunghwa Code excludes 1,872 combinations from base-84
mugunghwa.profanityFilteringDesc2: to prevent exposure to profanity or hard-to-pronounce words.
mugunghwa.paperTitle: Base-72 Representation System in Korean Using Syllable Block Structure
mugunghwa.author: Author: Hamin Lee
mugunghwa.paperDescription: Developed a base-72 encoding system using pure Korean, inspired by base-32 that mixes letters and numbers. Proposed an algorithm to compress GPS coordinates with 3-meter accuracy into five Korean characters. Based on this paper, developed and published the JavaScript-based open-source implementation 'Mugunghwa Code' on GitHub.
mugunghwa.downloadDescription: Download 5,184 profanity-filtered Mugunghwa Code combinations. Can be used for various purposes such as naming, code generation, etc.
mugunghwa.codeToConvert: Mugunghwa code to convert to number

biggest.pageDescription: A lightweight 2kb library for safely calculating arbitrary-precision large integers and decimals
biggest.title: Biggest
biggest.subtitle: Arbitrary Precision Math Library
biggest.introduction: Biggest is a lightweight library that safely calculates arbitrary-precision large integers and decimals beyond JavaScript's Number type limits. It supports complex mathematical operations in just 2kb.
biggest.feature1: Arbitrary Precision: Calculate integers and decimals without size limits
biggest.feature4: Basic Operations: Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division
biggest.feature5: String-Based: String operations without precision loss

pseudoShuffle.pageTitle: Pseudo Shuffle - FPE-Based Pseudo-Random Shuffle Library
pseudoShuffle.pageDescription: A TypeScript library that calculates shuffled-looking indices without actually shuffling
pseudoShuffle.title: Pseudo Shuffle
pseudoShuffle.subtitle: FPE-Based Pseudo-Random Shuffle Library
pseudoShuffle.introduction: Pseudo Shuffle is a TypeScript library that uses FPE (Format-Preserving Encryption) homomorphic encryption algorithms to make very large ranges of indices appear shuffled without actually shuffling them. It can instantly calculate non-overlapping shuffled indices using pseudo-random concepts without using DB or memory.
pseudoShuffle.feature2: Memory Efficient: Instant calculation without DB or memory
pseudoShuffle.feature3: Deterministic: Always same results with same seed
pseudoShuffle.feature4: Large Scale: Handles billions of indices
pseudoShuffle.feature5: TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions provided
pseudoShuffle.useCase1: Ticket Numbers: Generate unpredictable unique ticket numbers
pseudoShuffle.useCase2: URL Shortening: Generate non-sequential short URL IDs
pseudoShuffle.useCase4: Game Logic: Fair random matching systems

edgeCrypto.pageDescription: Encrypt, sign, hash, and manage RSA keys across Node.js, browsers, Cloudflare Workers, Deno, and Bun.
edgeCrypto.title: Edge Crypto
edgeCrypto.subtitle: Universal SubtleCrypto Toolkit
edgeCrypto.introduction: Edge Crypto is a unified cryptographic utility library that works across all JavaScript runtimes including Node.js, browsers, Cloudflare Workers, Deno, and Bun without external dependencies. It provides a consistent interface based on the Web Crypto API.
edgeCrypto.feature2: Zero Dependencies: Works without external libraries
edgeCrypto.feature3: Web Crypto API: Based on standard API
edgeCrypto.feature4: RSA Support: Key generation, encryption, signing
edgeCrypto.feature5: TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions provided

gaussSpiral.pageTitle: Gauss Spiral - Spiral Coordinate System Library
gaussSpiral.pageDescription: Calculates coordinates for an efficient coordinate system that fills pixels in a spiral rotation.
gaussSpiral.title: Gauss Spiral
gaussSpiral.subtitle: Spiral Coordinate System Library
gaussSpiral.introduction: Gauss Spiral is a TypeScript library that efficiently computes (x, y) â†” n mapping for spiral enumeration filling circles with points from center outward. It's useful for traversing 2D space points in a spiral or converting indices to coordinates.
gaussSpiral.feature1: Bidirectional Conversion: Coordinate â†” index conversion
gaussSpiral.feature3: Spiral Traversal: Expands from center outward
gaussSpiral.feature4: Mathematical Accuracy: Based on Gauss algorithm
gaussSpiral.feature5: TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions provided
gaussSpiral.useCase1: Image Processing: Process pixels from center outward
gaussSpiral.useCase2: Game Development: Spiral map generation and exploration
gaussSpiral.explanationText1: Imagine starting at the center pixel (0, 0) and expanding outward, plotting points so that a circle fills seamlessly. This library can compute:
gaussSpiral.explanationItem1: â€¢ Given a point's coordinates (x, y), exactly which turn n it was placed on
gaussSpiral.explanationItem2: â€¢ Given a step n, the exact coordinates (x, y) to plot next
gaussSpiral.explanationText2: Useful for pixel plotting, particle systems, procedural art, or any visualization requiring a deterministic spiral fill expanding from center outward.
gaussSpiral.featureDeterministicDesc: Stable, reproducible order for all grid points
gaussSpiral.featureBidirectionalDesc: Both (x, y) â†’ n and n â†’ (x, y) conversions supported
gaussSpiral.featureGeometryDesc: Simple arithmetic and atan2 ordering, no complex number theory needed
gaussSpiral.featureProgressiveDesc: Ideal for progressive rendering or streaming updates
gaussSpiral.featureRingSamplingDesc: Easily iterate points by radius ring for effects and batching
gaussSpiral.exampleVisualDesc1: Progressive radial reveals, spiral particle emission, halo expansion effects
gaussSpiral.exampleVisualDesc2: Loop n = 1..N, plot getCoordinates(n), stop when xÂ² + yÂ² exceeds radius
gaussSpiral.exampleGISDesc1: Prioritize fetching tiles around center tile (cx, cy) in spiral order to maximize perceived responsiveness
gaussSpiral.exampleGISDesc2: Use getCoordinates(n) as offset from (cx, cy)
gaussSpiral.exampleGameDesc1: Load chunks around player in circular-priority fashion, avoiding diamond or square-shaped artifacts
gaussSpiral.exampleGameDesc2: Compute loading order with getCoordinates(n) or assign priority to known chunks via getNFromCoordinates(dx, dy)
gaussSpiral.problemDefinitionDesc: When plotting integer points in an outward-expanding spiral from the origin:
gaussSpiral.problemItem1: â€¢ Determine n (visit index) for a given (x, y)
gaussSpiral.problemItem2: â€¢ Determine (x, y) (coordinates visited at step n) for a given n
gaussSpiral.approachDesc1: Group points by squared radius m = xÂ² + yÂ² (concentric "rings"). Within each ring, sort points clockwise by polar angle atan2(y, x).
gaussSpiral.approachDesc2: The global index n is the cumulative count of all points with smaller m plus the position within the current ring.
gaussSpiral.algorithmRingDesc: For each integer m â‰¥ 0, the ring contains all integer solutions to xÂ² + yÂ² = m
gaussSpiral.algorithmOrderDesc: Sort solutions by atan2(y, x) descending (clockwise)
gaussSpiral.algorithmGlobalIndexDesc: Let S(m) be the count of integer points with xÂ² + yÂ² â‰¤ m. For (x, y) with xÂ² + yÂ² = m, n = S(m-1) + k (k is 1-based position in ring)
gaussSpiral.algorithmInverseDesc: Binary search for minimum m where S(m) â‰¥ n, set k = n - S(m-1), return k-th point in ring sorted as above
gaussSpiral.apiGetNDesc: Returns the 1-based visit index n of (x, y) in the spiral enumeration.
gaussSpiral.apiGetCoordsDesc: Returns the grid coordinates visited at step n. (n must be greater than 0)
gaussSpiral.performanceNote1: â€¢ S(m) counting is implemented as O(âˆšm) by aggregating lattice points per x using symmetry
gaussSpiral.performanceNote2: â€¢ n â†’ (x, y) uses binary search over m around an initial guess, then sorts only the ring points for that m
gaussSpiral.spiralViewerDesc: This visualization shows a unique spiral coordinate system that starts at (0,0) and expands outward in a clockwise direction. Move the slider to generate coordinates from 1 onwards and observe how they form concentric layers around the origin.

curseScript.pageDescription: A JavaScript obfuscator that converts code into cursed spell-like syntax using ancient characters
curseScript.title: Curse Script
curseScript.subtitle: JavaScript Obfuscator
curseScript.introduction: Curse Script is a fun obfuscation tool that transforms JavaScript code into spell-like obfuscated syntax. It uses ancient characters and special symbols to make code unreadable while still executing normally.
curseScript.feature1: Multiple Character Sets: Runic, Old Persian, Emoji, or custom characters
curseScript.feature2: Full Obfuscation: Converts JavaScript into unreadable but executable code
curseScript.feature3: TypeScript Support: Complete type definitions included
curseScript.feature4: Custom Characters: Use any Unicode characters for obfuscation
curseScript.feature5: Executable Output: Generated code runs in any JavaScript environment
curseScript.runicDesc: Uses ancient Runic characters (áš -áš·) for mystical obfuscation
curseScript.oldPersianDesc: Employs cuneiform script (ðŽ -ðŽ·) for ancient code aesthetics
curseScript.emojiDesc: Transforms code into emoji sequences (ðŸ˜€-ðŸ˜—) for playful obfuscation
curseScript.noneDesc: Uses Latin characters (A-X) for basic obfuscation without special characters
curseScript.customCharacterSetsDesc1: You can provide your own array of at least 24 unique Unicode characters.
curseScript.customCharacterSetsDesc2: The characters will map to variables A-X in order, allowing complete customization.
curseScript.obfuscationProcessDesc1: Unlike conventional obfuscators that simply rename identifiers or gzip strings, Curse Script code-golfs every fragment so the payload contains no legible traces of the original program.
curseScript.obfuscationProcessDesc2: The prelude starts with minimal assignments like A = '' and then abuses coercion (e.g., B = !A + A, D = A + { }) to mine words such as "true", "false", and "[object Object]" without ever typing them directly.
curseScript.obfuscationProcessDesc3: Those harvested substrings are recombined to synthesize critical tokens: E = B[A++] plucks the letter "t", I = D[G+H] reveals "constructor", and stacking them inside J(...) produces a reference to the Function constructor entirely through side effects.
curseScript.obfuscationProcessDesc4: Each source character is re-expressed via these golfed variablesâ€”common glyphs come from a lookup table, while the rest are rebuilt on demand through Unicode escape expressions that even handle surrogate pairs for astral symbols.
curseScript.obfuscationProcessDesc5: All pieces are concatenated into J(... )();, invoking the synthesized Function; the final pass optionally remaps variables Aâ€“X to Runic, Old Persian, emoji, or custom glyphs, cementing the spell-like appearance while keeping the script executable.
